Package com.example.qrcheckin.core

Class Database

java.lang.Object
com.example.qrcheckin.core.Database
public class Database extends Object
This class is used to interact with the Firestore database It can be used to fetch, add, edit and delete users It can also be used to add events and check in users to events

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static interface 
    Database.OnCheckInCountRetrievedListener
    Used so the UserArrayAdaptor can handle the retrieved check-in count in its onCheckInCountRetrieved method Reference: Gemini Prompt: How could I update the database function to be callable in the UserArrayAdaptor class so that I could set the text of user_number_of_checkins to the number of time the user has checked into a specific event without introducing a new field numCheckIns in the user store?
    static interface 
    Database.OnGeoPointsFetchedListener
     
    static interface 
    Database.UserListener

  • Constructor Details

    • Database

      public Database()
      Create a new Database object initialize the database and the collections

    • Database

      public Database(android.content.Context context)
      Create a new Database object initialize the database and the collections and set the UserListener
      Parameters:
      context - The context of the UserListener (usually the activity)

  • Method Details

    • getUser

      public void getUser(String id)
      Get a user from the database by id and call the UserListener.onUserFetched method It will throw a RuntimeException if the UserListener is not set
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the user

    • editUser

      public void editUser(@NonNull User user)
      Update an existing user (with the same id), will fail if the user does not exist
      Parameters:
      user - The user edit

    • addUser

      public void addUser(@NonNull User user)
      Add a new user to the database, call the UserListener.onUserAdded method
      Parameters:
      user - The user to add, the id of the user will be changed to the id of the document in the database

    • deleteUser

      public void deleteUser(String id)
      Delete a user from the database
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the user to delete

    • addEvent

      public void addEvent(@NonNull Event event)
      Adds a given event to the database of available events
      Parameters:
      event -

    • checkIn

      public void checkIn(User user, Event event)
      Check in a user to an event
      Parameters:
      user - The user to check in
      event - The event to check in to

    • checkInWithGeo

      public void checkInWithGeo(User user, Event event, double latitude, double longitude)
      Check in a user to an event with geo location
      Parameters:
      user - The user to check in
      event - The event to check in to
      latitude - The latitude of the user's location
      longitude - The longitude of the user's location

    • getUserPicture

      public void getUserPicture(User user, android.widget.ImageView imageView)
      This method fetches the picture of a user from the storage and sets it to an ImageView ByteArray to bitmap, Dipak Keshariya, HB., accessed on 2024-02-28
      Parameters:
      user - the user to fetch the picture from
      imageView - the ImageView to set the picture to

    • getEventPicture

      public void getEventPicture(Event event, android.widget.ImageView imageView)
      This method fetches the picture of an event from the storage and sets it to an ImageView
      Parameters:
      event - the event to fetch the picture from
      imageView - the ImageView to set the picture to

    • onEventListChanged

      public static void onEventListChanged(ArrayList<Event> eventList, androidx.lifecycle.MutableLiveData<EventArrayAdaptor> mEventArrayAdaptor, String currentUserId, String type, String search)
      This static function is used to set on event listeners to the list of events from the database It's used to update the list of events in the EventArrayAdaptor in all three explore, my and hosted events
      Parameters:
      eventList - the list to update
      mEventArrayAdaptor - the MutableLiveData of the EventArrayAdaptor to notify the adaptor of the change
      currentUserId - the id of the current user from the app user
      type - the type of the event list, explore, my or hosted
      search - the search string to filter the events

    • deleteEvent

      public static void deleteEvent(String id)
      Delete an event from the database
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the event to delete

    • getUsersSignedUpToEvent

      public static void getUsersSignedUpToEvent(ArrayList<User> userList, androidx.lifecycle.MutableLiveData<UserArrayAdaptor> mUserArrayAdaptor, String currentEventID)
      Gets the list of users signed up to an event
      Parameters:
      userList - The empty list that is to be filled with users
      mUserArrayAdaptor - The MutableLiveData of the UserArrayAdaptor
      currentEventID - The id of the current event

    • signUpUser

      public void signUpUser(User user, Event event)
      Sign up the user to the given event
      Parameters:
      user - The user to be signed up
      event - The event the user is signing up to

    • getCheckInCountForUser

      public static void getCheckInCountForUser(String userId, String eventId, Database.OnCheckInCountRetrievedListener listener)
      Retrieves the number of checkins for a specific user and event
      Parameters:
      userId - The string id of the user
      eventId - The string id of the event
      listener - The listener to be used for callback Reference: Gemini Prompt: How could I update the database function to be callable in the UserArrayAdaptor class so that I could set the text of user_number_of_checkins to the number of time the user has checked into a specific event without introducing a new field numCheckIns in the user store?

    • deleteImage

      public static void deleteImage(User user, ImagesUserArrayAdaptor imagesUserArrayAdaptor)
      delete an image on firebase storage of a user
      Parameters:
      user - the user to delete the image from
      imagesUserArrayAdaptor - the adaptor to notify of the change

    • getAllImages

      public static void getAllImages(ImagesEventArrayAdaptor events, ImagesUserArrayAdaptor users)
      Fetches all the images from the database and sets them to the adaptors
      Parameters:
      events - the adaptor for the events
      users - the adaptor for the users

    • getAllImagesUserPicture

      public static void getAllImagesUserPicture(ImagesUserArrayAdaptor imagesUserArrayAdaptor, int position, android.widget.ImageView imageView)
      get the certain image of a single user
      Parameters:
      imagesUserArrayAdaptor - the adaptor to set to
      position - the position of the user in the list
      imageView - the image view to set the image to
